image.altText: Gurjinder Singh with his arm around Dharmvir Singh.

props.synopsis: While a two-year-old girl was saved, the girl's father Dharmvir Singh, 38, and grandfather Gurjinder Singh, 65, got into trouble in the pool's deep end and couldn't be revived.

title.children: The tragic deaths of a father and son raise a question — why do adult men face a heightened risk of drowning?

image.altText: Image of Zomi Frankcom smiling while wearing a cap and a black t-shirt with the WCK logo. Behind her are a lot of kids.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he has spoken with his Israeli counterpart following Israel's air strike that killed an Australian aid worker in central Gaza.

title.children: Anthony Albanese tells Israeli prime minister Australians outraged over Zomi Frankcom's death

image.altText: Signage on the side of the Central Law Courts building in Perth during the daytime.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd, who died in hospital after self-harming in youth detention, reveals he had an extensive history of expressing suicidal thoughts. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: 'Deeply unsettled': Inquest reveals extensive history of self-harm before Cleveland Dodd died in custody

image.altText: The top of a vehicle, with a large blast hole in it, seen from above

props.synopsis: The Israeli air strike that killed seven aid workers in Gaza, including Australian Lalzawmi "Zomi" Frankcom, was a "mistake that followed a misidentification," the Israeli military says.

title.children: 'Misidentification' was behind Gaza air strike that killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom, Israeli military says

image.altText: A selfie of Steven Rhain Pinker.

props.synopsis: After being called for a welfare check, police force their way into an inner-Brisbane unit and discover the body of a woman with stab wounds.

title.children: Brisbane man charged with murdering his mother after body found with stab wounds

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking into court.

props.synopsis: A former Seven Network producer claims the broadcaster paid for "illicit drugs and prostitutes" as part of its efforts to secure an exclusive sit-down interview with Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Federal Court publishes affidavit detailing Seven Network payments to Bruce Lehrmann, including for sex, drugs

image.altText: Woman with black glasses smiles

props.synopsis: Samantha Mostyn AO will replace current Governor-General David Hurley, becoming the second woman to hold the position.

title.children: Prime minister announces Samantha Mostyn as Australia's next governor-general

image.altText: A tilted multistorey building in a busy street

props.synopsis: Taiwan's Central Weather Administration says the earthquake is the country's biggest in 25 years. Follow live.

title.children: Taiwan hit by magnitude-7.5 earthquake, collapsing buildings

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: National Fire Agency: Four people have died
One person suspected to have been crushed to death in rockfall
Philippines and Japan cancel tsunami warning

image.altText: Pepole in protective clothing stand in the remains of a partially collapsed building.

props.synopsis: Japan and the Philippines lift all their tsunami warnings and advisories after an earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.5 struck near Taiwan, killing at least one person.

title.children: At least one person dead and 50 others injured after magnitude-7.5 earthquake near Taiwan

image.altText: Generic image of police tape strung up across an out of focus crime scene.

props.synopsis: Police initially thought a 21-year-old man who was found unconscious when his car hit a fence pole on a rural property died from the crash, but now allege he was shot.

title.children: Queensland man accused of deadly shooting on rural property granted bail

image.altText: Man and woman and three boys sitting around a dining table eating and smiling at each other.

props.synopsis: Young father Zane Warrell has been given a lifeline against "debilitating" bowel disease, as national case numbers rise.

title.children: 'It broke my heart': How families are coping with rising bowel disease

image.altText: A pink medical alert pendant with a silver SOS button and a black strap sitting on a white table top.

props.synopsis: Users of medical alarm pendants say their devices have been contacted by callers on unknown numbers, but a company that sells them says customers should not be worried.

title.children: Has a stranger on an unknown number ever called your medical alarm pendant? This is why

image.altText: Mim Fox stands in a backyard garden slightly smiling

props.synopsis: Mim was denied credit from her bank because of her single status, but before that, she was ignored and "cut loose" when she asked for financial hardship help. She's not alone, with complaints about banks and lenders on the rise.

title.children: When Mim's mortgage went up by $1,200 a month she asked her bank for help and never heard back

image.altText: Four SES volunteers in bright orange jumpsuits can be seen in tall and dense grass that is up to their chests.

props.synopsis: The family of missing 80-year-old Peter Roach says his Queensland hospital failed to keep him safe, as right to information documents show supervisors were not always informed when he left his ward.

title.children: Hospital changes too late to save dementia patient who walked out never to be seen again

image.altText: Sally Pearson

props.synopsis: Olympic legends such as Grant Hackett and Sally Pearson hit out at plans for Brisbane 2032 as the Queensland premier defends his government's stance.

title.children: Queensland premier hits back at Olympians over open letter criticising Brisbane 2032 plans

image.altText: An aerial view of a Sydney-to-Melbourne train that derailed near Wallan on February 20, 2020.

props.synopsis: Two rail companies have been fined a total of $525,000 over a fatal train crash at Wallan, on Melbourne's outskirts, in 2020. The train driver and his co-worker died in the crash.

title.children: Companies fined over 2020 train crash that left driver and co-worker dead

image.altText: Former PM Tony Abbott, smirking, sits next to Peter Dutton, smiling, in a joint party room meeting

props.synopsis: While we assume that federal politics is often an argument between two major parties or competing philosophies, there is another undercurrent that exists within governments and is blowing up again right now, which is: Politicians vs Lawyers.

title.children: In 2015, Tony Abbott held a cabinet meeting that sent lawyers berserk and it's flaring once more

image.altText: A man with brown hair and a moustache on the left and above ground at a mine with piles of dirt and machinery.

props.synopsis: Internal emails show an engineer asked the Ballarat Gold Mine management in May last year not to proceed with a handheld drilling trial without "minimum" ground supports "to ensure that we all get home to our families".

title.children: Engineer sent email warning Ballarat Gold Mine of air legging dangers months before fatal collapse

image.altText: Comedian Joe Flaherty in 1982 while he was starring in Canadian sketch show SCTV.

props.synopsis: The Freaks and Geeks and SCTV star is remembered as "the nicest guy you could know", after dying on Monday following a brief illness.

title.children: Adam Sandler, Mark Hamill and more pay tribute to 'genius of a comedian' Joe Flaherty

image.altText: A gun made from pipe parts and nuts and bolts.

props.synopsis: Police officers on patrol arrested the 19-year-old man in Hobart's CBD after an alleged theft from a business, and found the 19-year-old with a loaded homemade gun.

title.children: Teen arrested in Hobart CBD with loaded pipe gun and ammunition

image.altText: Smoke rising from Gaza after intense bombing.

props.synopsis: The US has in recent days reportedly green-lit the transfer of billions of dollars' worth of bombs to Israel, including warplanes and 900-kilogram bombs that have been blamed for mass civilian casualties.

title.children: 'It turns earth into liquid': These are the bombs the US is reportedly sending Israel

image.altText: A satellite image of a port, with several markers added later identifying new buildings

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin is being humiliated in the Black Sea, where a third of Russia's naval fleet has been destroyed by Ukraine's attacks. Some say a plan to move the surviving vessels into a new port could draw a third country directly into the war.

title.children: A flurry of activity in a Russian port suggests Putin is up to something. Here's what we know

image.altText: Two boys look at a phone and another looks away and laugh

props.synopsis: The NT police commissioner says a dangerous game is being played by young people in Alice Springs who post, then boast, about their crimes on social media. Experts say it's a nationwide issue.

title.children: 'We feel angry': Alice Springs teens frustrated by rise in social media crime

image.altText: Crows pitch invader

props.synopsis: The league bans an Adelaide man from all future AFL and AFLW games after he invaded the pitch during a Crows and Cats clash.

title.children: AFL hands Adelaide pitch invader a life ban for 'unsafe and unlawful' incident during Cats game

image.altText: A t-shaped copper IUD in front of a dark background with a pink sold out tag attached.

props.synopsis: Australian women are struggling to get copper intra-uterine devices (IUDs), with suppliers and authorities at odds over whether there is a shortage.

title.children: Patients struggle to access non-hormonal contraception amid confusion about supply

image.altText: two joeys look at the camera from a pouch

props.synopsis: Six weeks on from a bushfire that ripped through 22,000 hectares of land west of Ballarat, wildlife carers say the impact on already stressed wildlife is heartbreaking.

title.children: Native animals that survived 'horrific' Victorian bushfire now facing increased threat from predators

image.altText: University

props.synopsis: A change to Centrelink rules on what constitutes a "dependent" student would better support regional university students who must move away from home to study, a report finds.

title.children: Centrelink's age of independence causing 'real inequity' between city and regional students

image.altText: Firefighters stand out the front of a recently burnt-out building

props.synopsis: Eight people have been detained after the fire broke out during daytime renovation work at a nightclub which is underneath a 16-storey residential building.

title.children: Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills at least 29 people as investigations into the blaze continue

image.altText: A collage showing Taylor Swift, Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg.

props.synopsis: The world's richest people have reportedly become $3 trillion richer, with 2023 turning out to be an "amazing year" for billionaires, while the Australian share market has dropped further from its record high. Follow live.

title.children: ASX falls on back of Wall Street, world's richest people reportedly increase net worth to $21.8 trillion

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Borrowing power would grow if RBA cuts the cash rate
Gold stocks rare bright spot on ASX today

image.altText: Ava DuVernay

props.synopsis: The film follows author Isabel Wilkerson’s journey of personal tragedy while writing her Pulitzer Prize-winning non-fiction book Caste: The Origins of Our Discontents.

title.children: How a book recommendation from Oprah inspired director Ava DuVernay's latest movie

image.altText: Bandt, in a puffy jacket, stands on the street behind a "Vote Yes" sign, handing out flyers.

props.synopsis: The Greens appear not to have made any major financial contribution to the Voice referendum campaign, according to figures released by the AEC on Tuesday, despite a withering internal battle that led to a senator quitting the party over her opposition.

title.children: Greens did not donate or spend money on Voice referendum campaign captured by AEC disclosures

image.altText: A composite image of a crocodile at Casuarina beach and Axle the dog.

props.synopsis: The owner of a fetch-obsessed dog says she will reconsider walking along a popular Darwin beach after her pet was set upon by a 2-metre crocodile.

title.children: 'Axle, get out!' Top End blue heeler escapes jaws of 2m saltwater crocodile
